intro: Rogeria longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered rogeria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by gardeners interested in exotic plants.
